economy.balance: Check your balance, or someone else's balance.
economy.daily: Collect some money once a day.
economy.crime: Shake down some people for some money.
economy.heist: Execute a daring raid on the impenetrable Fort Knick-Knacks.
economy.slots: Gamble your life away at the slot machines.
economy.gamble: Bet big on the Wumpus Races.

commands.emotes: Fun little emote commands. You need to mention someone to use them.

levels.rank: Check your rank, or someone else's rank.
levels.profile: Check your profile card, or someone else's.
levels.score: Check your score, or someone else's.

misc.rubeface: Rubeface, the perfect meme for every situation.
misc.snowman: Do you want to build a snowman?
misc.bootlegcat: See a bootleg cat, for when mew.cat doesn't work.
misc.tato: Mewna Miner - Like Cookie Clicker, but tato-flavoured.
misc.dnd: Get useful information for your D&D 5e game.

pay.needs-mention: You need to mention someone to pay.
pay.needs-mention-amount: You need to mention someone to pay, and specify an amount to pay.

daily.failure-wait: You can collect your daily again in **$time**.
daily.streak-break: It's been more than 2 days since you last collected your daily $symbol, so your streak has reset.

crime.1: You steal candy from a baby and sell it back to him, netting you **$amount$symbol**.
crime.2: You sell someone a shiny (but worthless) rock for **$amount$symbol**.
crime.3: You pretend to get hit by someone's Wumpus, and scam Bamboozle Insurance:tm: out of **$amount$symbol**.
crime.4: You successfully steal a cash register, and take the **$amount$symbol** inside.
crime.5: You sell someone a rotten :potato: for **$amount$symbol**.
crime.6: You robbed the Society of Schmoogaloo and ended up in a lake, but still managed to steal **$amount$symbol**.
crime.7: You start the Cult of Wumpus, and scam the cult members out of **$amount$symbol**.
crime.8: You kidnap someone's pet Wumpus, only returning it after they pay the ransom of **$amount$symbol**.
crime.9: You sell candy to young school children, bringing in **$amount$symbol**.
crime.10: You sell a Wumpus to the circus for **$amount$symbol**.

heist.success: You break into Fort Knick-Knacks and steal **$amount$symbol** from inside.
heist.failure: Oh no! The guards caught you! They take **$amount$symbol** from you and let you go.

slots.nothing: The slot machine paid out nothing...
slots.boom: Oh no! The slot machine exploded! You pay out **$amount$symbol** to cover the repair cost.

gamble.result: You head off to the Wumpus Races to gamble your life away. You bet **$amount$symbol** on wumpus **#$number**.
gamble.success: You bet on the right one! You win **$amount$symbol** for betting right.
gamble.failure: You bet on a loser! Your **$amount$symbol** is gone forever...

market.buy-sell: You can buy and sell items with the `buy` and `sell`.

buy.full-inventory: Your inventory is full! Try selling some stuff first...
buy.no-item: You have to tell me what to buy.

sell.not-enough-item: You don't have enough of that to sell.
sell.no-item: You have to tell me what to sell.

mine.full-inventory: Your inventory is full! Try selling some stuff first.
mine.no-pick: You don't have a `pickaxe`, so you can't mine. Perhaps you should `buy` one...
mine.pick-break: Oh no! Your pickaxe broke when you tried to use it!
mine.got-dust: You mined all day, but found nothing but dust.

fish.full-inventory: Your inventory is full! Try selling some stuff first.
fish.no-rod: You don't have a `fishingrod`, so you can't mine. Perhaps you should `buy` one...
fish.pick-break: Oh no! Your fishing rod broke when you tried to use it!
fish.got-water: You fished all day, but found nothing but empty water.
